content: free mini pattern hidden key 1 amigurumi school of magic - 6th term by airali design and irene strange ##aammiigguurruummiisscchhoooollooffmmaaggiicc hidden key materials size construction > cotton dk yarn in 7 5 cm / 3 long if made using the the key is made in one piece dark grey suggested materials starch or pva glue is used to light grey make it more stiff or any colour of your choice difficulty easy > 2 5 to 3 mm crochet hook special stitches > starch or pva glue optional tlo third loop only > tapestry needle instructions make in dark grey or any other colour of your 1 2 3 choice ch12 slip_stitch in first chain to join in a circle img 1 working inside the circle the chain are hidden inside the single_crochet stitches 12sc img 2 ch12 tip work in the third loop of the chain for a neater result starting in second chain from hook 2sc img 3 ch3 starting in second chain from hook 2slst continue along the main chain 2sc repeat 2 times img 4 5sc along the main 4 5 6 chain continue working into the circle pushing the stitches close together img 5 12sc fasten_off and join invisibly using a tapestry needle img 6 optional make a long string of chains to tie more keys together how to stiffen the key take out the key and squeeze as tight as you can to remove excess liquid - the leftovers can to stiffen your key you can use some fabric be re-used for another key starch or pva glue when working with glue we put the key onto the covered work surface and recommend you cover your work surface with carefully pull the fabric into the right shape protective film and wear household gloves to avoid this step is very important this is a one-way sticky fingers process and the fabric will stay in the shape mix 1 part of glue and 3 parts of water in a little you set forever pot an empty yoghurt pot will work well stir once shaped let the key dry out completely the mixture together for best results we recommend leaving it dip the key into the liquid and move it around overnight - drying time will depend on room until all of the fabric is soaked through temperature and humidity this crochet pattern is part of the amigurumi school of magic 6 by airali design and irene strange 2 this pdf is strictly for personal non-commercial use copy distribution or commercial use of this pattern or any of its parts are not allowed for any information contact amigurumiadvent@gmail com would you like to keep crocheting along with us sign-ups for amigurumi school of magic 6 mcal are open on ravelry and etsy take advantage of the early-bird discount as soon as you sign-up you can 40% off until october 1st 2024 download a 24-pages pdf file with the secret toadstool + an introduction to the mcal +
